intro: Lavoisiera minima, commonly known as the small lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Lavoisiera minima typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in humid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland ecosystems and ecological studies.
